title: Appeals Court Rejects Ohio’s Bid to Halt Opioid Trial
text:
A federal appellate court Thursday denied last-minute attempts to halt a coming trial seeking to blame the pharmaceutical industry for sparking the opioid crisis and to remove the judge overseeing the case.

The pair of decisions clears the way for a landmark trial scheduled to begin in less than two weeks in a federal court in Cleveland. The cases of two Ohio counties hard hit by opioid addiction were selected to go to trial first from more than 2,000 cases brought by local governments, Native American tribes and others consolidated...
